.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.ICancellableAsyncResult BeginOpenRead(class System.AsyncCallback callback, object state) cil managed

Docs.param: An delegate that will receive notification when the asynchronous operation completes.
A user-defined object that will be passed to the callback delegate.
Docs.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to open a stream for reading from the blob.
Docs.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks On the <xref:System.IO.Stream> object returned by the <xref:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.CloudBlob.EndOpenRead%2A> method, the <xref:System.IO.Stream.EndRead%2A> method must be called exactly once for every <xref:System.IO.Stream.BeginRead%2A> call. Failing to end the read process before beginning another read process can cause unexpected behavior.
Note that this method always makes a call to the <xref:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.CloudBlob.BeginFetchAttributes%2A> method under the covers.
Set the <xref:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.CloudBlob.StreamMinimumReadSizeInBytes%2A> property before calling this method to specify the minimum number of bytes to buffer when reading from the stream. The value must be at least 16 KB.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.ICancellableAsyncResult BeginRotateEncryptionKey (AsyncCallback callback, object state);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.ICancellableAsyncResult BeginRotateEncryptionKey(class System.AsyncCallback callback, object state) cil managed

Docs.param: An delegate that will receive notification when the asynchronous operation completes.
A user-defined object that will be passed to the callback delegate.
Docs.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to rotate the encryption key on this blob. This method rotates only the KEK, not the CEK. For more information, visit https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-client-side-encryption/
Docs.returns: An that references the asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method has a number of prerequisites: 1. The blob must be encrypted on the service using client-side encryption (not service-side encryption.) 2. The local object must have the latest attributes from the blob on the service. This can be done by calling FetchAttributes() on the blob, or by listing blobs in the container with metadata. 3. The Encryption Policy on the default BlobRequestOptions must contain an IKeyResolver capable of resolving the old encryption key. 4. The Encryption Policy on the default BlobRequestOptions must contain an IKey with the new encryption key.

## Remarks On the <xref:System.IO.Stream> object returned by this method, the <xref:System.IO.Stream.EndRead%2A> method must be called exactly once for every <xref:System.IO.Stream.BeginRead%2A> call. Failing to end the read process before beginning another read process can cause unexpected behavior.
Note that this method always makes a call to the <xref:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.CloudBlob.FetchAttributesAsync%2A> method under the covers.
Set the <xref:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.CloudBlob.StreamMinimumReadSizeInBytes%2A> property before calling this method to specify the minimum number of bytes to buffer when reading from the stream. The value must be at least 16 KB.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RotateEncryptionKey(class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.AccessCondition accessCondition, class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.BlobRequestOptions options, class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.OperationContext operationContext) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that represents the condition that must be met in order for the request to proceed. For this operation, there must not be an , , , or condition. An condition will be added internally.
A object that specifies additional options for the request.
An object that represents the context for the current operation.
Docs.summary: Rotates the encryption key on this blob. This method rotates only the KEK, not the CEK. For more information, visit https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-client-side-encryption/

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method has a number of prerequisites: 1. The blob must be encrypted on the service using client-side encryption (not service-side encryption.) 2. The local object must have the latest attributes from the blob on the service. This can be done by calling FetchAttributes() on the blob, or by listing blobs in the container with metadata. 3. The Encryption Policy on the default BlobRequestOptions must contain an IKeyResolver capable of resolving the old encryption key. 4. The Encryption Policy on the default BlobRequestOptions must contain an IKey with the new encryption key.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.StorageUri StorageUri { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.StorageUri StorageUri

Docs.summary: Gets the blob's URIs for both the primary and secondary locations.
Docs.value: An object of type containing the blob's URIs for both the primary and secondary locations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If your storage account uses read-access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS), you can design your application to read from the secondary location if the primary location should become unavailable. The StorageURI property returns both the primary and secondary URIs for the container.
> [!NOTE] > The StorageURI property is a client-side property, so it will return a secondary URI whether or not RA-GRS is enabled. However, if RA-GRS is not enabled, then subsequent calls against the secondary URI will fail.

.property instance int32 StreamMinimumReadSizeInBytes

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of bytes to buffer when reading from a blob stream.
Docs.value: The minimum number of bytes to buffer, being at least 16 KB.

MemberSignature.Value: public Uri Uri { get; }
.property instance class System.Uri Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the blob's URI for the primary location.
Docs.value: A specifying the absolute URI to the blob at the primary location.

Docs.summary: Initiates an asynchronous operation to abort an ongoing blob copy operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The AbortCopyAsync method aborts a copy operation, leaving a destination blob with zero length and complete metadata. Use the copy ID returned by the <xref:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Storage.Blob.CloudBlob.StartCopyAsync%2A> method to abort the copy operation.
For more information about aborting a copy operation, see [Abort Copy Blob](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1bb2695e-5fe2-4394-9b61-0c67fa07c240).
